title: Archive through April 02, 2003
content:
Ok, here goes a hint:   
This font is defined on the foundry site, as 'a typeface with a twist'.   
The foundry is one of the 'big dogs'.
author: antiuser

comments.content: Close, but no.
lc p "GiddyUp" from Linotype designed by Laurie Szujewska

Yes, Peter's got it!   
Your turn now!

blast! my internet goes down for a few days and   
i come back a stranger. the part that chaps my   
hide is that i was just at safetyorange the   
other day. i guess i should be more observant.   
sonuvuh...!
I was sure you were gonna get that one Isaac ;-)

OK! Here we go - foundry & character:   
 ![Quiz Zaturday!](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8138.gif)   
   
I'm hitting bed now but I will check back first thing tomorrow if you need any clues.   
/peter
ARS Temper script, lc

And I thought this one would be harder than the last one I sent in ;)   
   
You are so right Emir - congratulations :-D   
   
Now let's see what you can come up with.
hihihi

That was a good post nonetheless, I really, really like ARS Temper.   
   
Here goes new one:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8151.gif)   
   
So: Characters, Font and Designer

Gentium Italic (characters d and q) by Victor Gaultney.   
 [http://www.sil.org/~gaultney/gentium/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533/http:/www.sil.org/~gaultney/gentium/)

???   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8154.gif)

Well... that was quick!   
   
Correct, Gentium it is.
It seems as if Heinrich already started next round...

maybe this time we can do 2 at once.   
heinrich: it's customary to allow the   
winner of the previous round to begin   
the next round. just so you know.

Thanks Isaac...   
   
Well, here is one from me - and it might be a tough one!   
 ![nk gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/8175.gif)

sorry for my hurries.   
my english is not good, i did not know it.

this from nicolai is DTL CASPARI REGULAR   
 [http://www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/CaspariRegular.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/CaspariRegular.html)

Way to go!   
   
Caspari. The most beautiful and expensive typeface I
Heinrich? Hint, please?
is heavy. that is not a classical font. only few more insider it will know. I legend only: Luc

Like the REDROOSTER Glasgow, but... NO!   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/glasgow-rr/book/win32-ttf/119785/character/0079/CP2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/glasgow-rr/book/win32-ttf/119785/character/0079/CP2/)

fabio, i think we are looking for heinrich's   
italic serif X now.   
as nikolai confirmed, the y is dtl caspari.   
   
btw, i don't have any idea what typeface X is.   
more hints, heinrich! ;)
Thanks EDUARDO (T
i think, this with the
no

Heinrich, you can't change image in the middle. Give us a new clue, (or at least tell us from which font the x is, before starting on a new...). I don't mind that it takes a while, the fun is to get new clues and finally find it.
[ITC Clover](http://web.archive.org/web/20130128103533/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/clover-itc/%20?refby=typographica)?
